com.reactivecascade.util

Class BindingContextUtil.AsyncFragmentActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.reactivecascade.util.BindingContextUtil.AsyncFragmentActivity
  • Enclosing class:
    BindingContextUtil

    public abstract static class BindingContextUtil.AsyncFragmentActivity
extends Object
    A parent class for a FragmentActivity that will provide a binding context to automatically pause/resume/close reactive bindings

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IBindingContext getPauseResumeBindingContext()
      Use this binding context if you want your reactive actions to end when the fragment pauses.
      IBindingContext<android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity> getStartStopBindingContext() 
      void onPause()
      Run when the binding context goes inactive Bound actions are stopped before the activity pauses
      void onResume()
      Run when the binding context returns from an inactive/paused state Bound actions are fired before the activity itself resumes in order to initialize variables for display
      void onStart()
      Run when the binding context returns from an inactive/paused state Bound actions are fired before the activity itself starts in order to initialize variables for display
      void onStop()
      Run when the binding context ends Bound actions are stopped before the activity stops

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getStartStopBindingContext

        @NonNull
 @UiThread
public final IBindingContext<android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity> getStartStopBindingContext()
        Returns:
        a new binding context each time the FragmentActivity is stopped

      • getPauseResumeBindingContext

        @NonNull
 @UiThread
public final IBindingContext getPauseResumeBindingContext()
        Use this binding context if you want your reactive actions to end when the fragment pauses. You should create this type of binding in your FragmentActivity.onResume() method
        Returns:
        a new binding context each time the application is paused

      • onPause

        @UiThread
 @CallSuper
public void onPause()
        Run when the binding context goes inactive Bound actions are stopped before the activity pauses

      • onResume

        @UiThread
 @CallSuper
public void onResume()
        Run when the binding context returns from an inactive/paused state Bound actions are fired before the activity itself resumes in order to initialize variables for display

      • onStart

        @UiThread
 @CallSuper
public void onStart()
        Run when the binding context returns from an inactive/paused state Bound actions are fired before the activity itself starts in order to initialize variables for display

      • onStop

        @UiThread
 @CallSuper
public void onStop()
        Run when the binding context ends Bound actions are stopped before the activity stops
